pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:0.5: 90. The training rule on itch covers
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.2: he allowed the itch-covering cloth for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.4: Knowing this, the monks from the group of six wore itch covers that were inappropriate in size.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.5: As they were walking about, they were dragging them along, both in front and behind.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.6: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.7: “How can the monks from the group of six wear such itch covers?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.11: “Foolish men, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.13: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.14.1: ‘If a monk is having an itch-covering cloth made, it should be made the right size.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.15: This is the right size: four standard handspans long and two wide.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.16: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.2: it is for the purpose of covering an itch or a boil or a running sore or a carbuncle, below the navel and above the knees.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.4: making it himself or having it made, it should be made the right size.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.5: This is the right size: four standard handspans long and two wide.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.6: If he makes one or has one made that exceeds that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.7: When he gets it, it is to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.8.1: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.9: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.10: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.11: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.12: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.13: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.15: if he makes it the right size;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.16: if he makes it smaller than the right size;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.17: if he gets one made by another that exceeds the right size and then cuts it down before using it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.18: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.20: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.21: The training rule on itch covers, the eighth, is finished.
